capstone.utility

Class KeyMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • capstone.utility.KeyMap
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.util.Map.Entry<InputKey,Direction>>

    public class KeyMap
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.util.Map.Entry<InputKey,Direction>>
    A bidirectional hashtable to map keys to directions for players. Extra overhead and care is taken to ensure a strong bijectivity between the keys and the direction. There must at most and at least one and only one key for each direction, i.e. this KeyMap contains four keys and four directions at all times and never more, nore less.

      • reverse

        public static <K,V> java.util.HashMap<V,K> reverse(java.util.HashMap<K,V> forward)
        Static method to reverse map, i.e. create a new map from the existing one, but with keys and values swapped entry-wise.
        Type Parameters:
        K - The key-type.
        V - The value-type.
        Parameters:
        forward - The forward mapping (key -> value).
        Returns:
        The backward mapping (value -> key).

        Returns:
        A ready-made KeyMap using the common arrow-keys.

      • set

        public void set(InputKey key,
                Direction direction)
        Sets the given key for the given direction. Bijectivity must not be violated and is heavily asserted.
        Parameters:
        key - The InputKey.
        direction - The Direction.
        See Also:
        swap(capstone.ui.InputKey, capstone.ui.InputKey)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of the KeyMap: [key: direction]. Full direction names are used.

      • toStringCompressed

        public java.lang.String toStringCompressed()
        Returns:
        A compressed string representation of the KeyMap: [key: direction]. Only the first character of direction names are used.
